column4: I'm trying to fcsk something on ubuntu cd atm however it keeps saying device or resource is busy
I'm pretty sure it's not mounted at all - any recommendations?
what are you going to do if it finds filesystem errors?
fsck the harddrive from ubuntu cd
and what is the command you are using?
I don't know, is there a way I can check? :-)
you cannot fsck devices. only partitions
well that would explain a bit
sudo fsck.ext4 /dev/sda1 (or fsck.ext3 and /dev/sda2 or somesuch)
how do I get a list of the partitions on the drive to access?
this won't delete any data wil it? :-)
depends. if there are bad issues that need to be fixed, it may.
I assume so - I didn't set it up but it woudln't be anything other than default
